critique: This document pertains to a minor administrative change, expanding the jurisdiction of the New England River Basins Commission to include additional areas in Vermont and Massachusetts. It is based on a request from the Governors of the member states and the Water Resources Council, and the President has determined that complying with the request is in the public interest. The action is taken under the authority of the Water Resources Planning Act. There is no clear indication of ideological bias, immigration stance, executive power grab, or impact on national security vs. civil liberties. It seems primarily focused on regional water resource management and cooperative federalism. There is a slight increase in federal power as the jurisdiction of a federal commission is expanded.
